author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Needs a `[compat]` section in `Project.toml` with at least an entry for `julia` itself, e.g.:
```toml
[compat]
julia = "1"
```
would mean that the package is compatible with Julia versions `[1.0.0, 2.0.0)`.

@StefanKarpinski Sorry, I always forget about this. Could it be automatically added when the `Project.toml` is created, set to the current major Julia version? 

What do I do now?

> What do I do now?

Make the requested changes, and retrigger the bot.
You don't have to change the version number, just keep the same and this PR will be updated.
I didn't change the version number on purpose - meanwhile, the package has reached v0.2.1 naturally. Can we scrap this and register 0.2.1 instead?

> I didn't change the version number on purpose - meanwhile, the package has reached v0.2.1 

What do you mean? You never released 0.2.0?

> Can we scrap this and register 0.2.1 instead?

Sure I guess...

I pushed 0.2.0 to master and triggered the bot. A few days have passed. Meanwhile, I've done more work and pushed 0.2.1 on master. 

It wouldn't be a big deal now, as this package is very new and most likely not used by anybody yet, but in a different scenario, there would be users on 0.2.1#master. So I couldn't just downgrade the codebase from master to 0.2.0. 

But for now, If it helps, sure, I can edit the version number and downgrade the codebase from 0.2.1. to 0.2.0 and retrigger the bot.
Okay. I think a better workflow might be to increment the version when you are actually releasing. You can update this, or make it 0.2.1 and then we can merge.
Thanks - let's kill this and I'll retrigger the bot in 0.2.1

body:
